jmvtools 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Perform a named group split.

    named_group_split.Rd

    Splits a dataframe into a list, with each list object named based on the value of the grouping variable.

    Usage

    named_group_split(.tbl, ...)

    Arguments

    .tbl

    tibble/dataframe input object

    ...

    additional params passed to dplyr::group_by()

    Value

    List of data frames, named based on the value of the grouping variable.

    Note

    stolen from https://github.com/tidyverse/dplyr/issues/4223

    Examples

    
mtcars |> named_group_split(cyl)
#> <list_of<
#>   tbl_df<
#>     mpg : double
#>     cyl : double
#>     disp: double
#>     hp  : double
#>     drat: double
#>     wt  : double
#>     qsec: double
#>     vs  : double
#>     am  : double
#>     gear: double
#>     carb: double
#>   >
#> >[3]>
#> $`4`
#> # A tibble: 11 × 11
#>      mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1  22.8     4 108      93  3.85  2.32  18.6     1     1     4     1
#>  2  24.4     4 147.     62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2
